text: Troon railway station was a railway station serving the town of Troon, South Ayrshire, Scotland. Located at Troon Harbour, this was the first railway station in the town and was part of the Kilmarnock and Troon Railway. == History == The station was opened on 6 July 1812.Butt (1995), page 234 The Glasgow, Paisley, Kilmarnock and Ayr Railway took over management of the station on 16 July 1846, however the station closed just days later on 20 July 1846. == References == === Notes === === Sources === * * Category:Disused railway stations in South Ayrshire Category:Railway stations in Great Britain opened in 1812 Category:Railway stations in Great Britain closed in 1846 Category:Troon
title: Troon (Harbour) railway station
